alert.note: Alert for Boone (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 9:54AM EDT until August 28 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL BOONE COUNTY... At 954 AM EDT, Radar and gauge reports indicated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen this morning. Although the heavy rain has since ended, runoff will continue to result in flash flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and public reports. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madison, Jeffrey and Turtle Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Pond Fork, Spruce Fork, Laurel Creek, Rock Creek, Robinson Creek, Turtle Creek, Big Creek, Hewett Creek, Big Ugly Creek, and Little Laurel Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
